data.title: dream vision

data.text:
noun [ C ]

uk

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/ˈdriːm ˌvɪʒ.ən/ us

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/ˈdriːm ˌvɪʒ.ən/

literature specialized

a type of poem, especially in medieval poetry, in which the poet describes someone falling asleep and dreaming the events that take place in the poem:

The poem is a dream vision in which the poet meets a woman who asks him to explain something to her.

Much medieval literature about the dead is in the form of dream visions.

something or someone that you see in a dream, or something that you experience in a dream, especially when this seems to show what will happen in the future :

He has a dream vision and sets off into to the desert to try and find it.

My paintings are not fantastic dream visions; they are things I have really seen.

More examplesFewer examples

The poem takes the form of a kind of moralizing dream vision.

Many poets have been inspired by dream visions.

I had a kind of dream vision, and the music is my response to that.
